name: ECS @ UoS
description:
In Electronics and Computer Science (ECS), we have created an environment that has inspired an extraordinary level of achievement. We seek to develop new research activities and educational programmes to continue our contributions to science and engineering in a world facing significant challenges.

Our research explores the interface between electronics and computer science, and benefits significantly from interdisciplinary links with other schools, institutes and faculties.

company_updates.reshared_post_description:
We are absolutely thrilled to announce that our very own Oana Lazar, EDA embedded software engineer, has been named a winner in the prestigious Women's Engineering Society (WES) "Top 50 Women in Engineering (WE50) 2025" awards! üèÜüéâ

This year's WE50 theme, "Together We Engineer," celebrates women who are trailblazers, showcasing the powerful impact made by female engineers across diverse sectors like transport, construction, technology, and healthcare. These awards highlight individuals who have truly excelled in their field, making significant contributions to areas like digital health, decarbonization, heritage projects, space science, sustainability, and accessibility. üí°

Oana's expertise and dedication in EDA embedded software engineering truly embody the spirit of these awards. Join us in congratulating Oana on this incredible and well-deserved recognition! üëè

company_updates.description:
#KEETakeover Day 2

Today we shine a spotlight on EPrints Services! Led by Professor Justin Bradley

What do open source, global impact, and a little Southampton ingenuity have in common? EPrints! Built for Open Access, Made at Southampton and  Trusted Worldwide!

EPrints isn‚Äôt just software, it‚Äôs a KEE success story .... Born in ECS back in 2000, it was the first open access repository platform of its kind. Now it powers research visibility across the globe, all while remaining proudly open source, flexible, and standards compliant.

Through EPrints Services, our team build, host, and tailor repositories that meet real institutional needs. That‚Äôs Knowledge Exchange in action:

 üõ†Ô∏è Turning academic research into sustainable services
 üåç Enabling open science and policy alignment worldwide
 üí∑ Bringing income, reputation and real-world impact back to the university
It‚Äôs practical, powerful, and pure Southampton.

Want to know more? The team‚Äôs here to help:
 üîó https://lnkd.in/eSNiNGdm

#KEETakeover #EPrints #KnowledgeExchange #OpenAccess #ECSatSouthampton #SouthamptonImpact #RepositoriesDoneRight

Need expert input without a long wait?  .. Why not hire us? 

ECS Partners is the consultancy arm of ECS at the University of Southampton. 

In today's #KEETakeover we are showcasing ECS Partners LTD. Consultancy doesn‚Äôt have to be slow, ECS offers fast, flexible access to leading engineers and scientists. 

We cover every part of EEE and Computer Science including AI, cyber, electronics, smart materials, biometrics, forensics, signal processing, robotics, ethics, systems, sustainability, component design and so much more! 

We don‚Äôt just do research, you can hire our ECS staff for:

‚úîÔ∏è Prototyping
‚úîÔ∏è Industry research & lit reviews
‚úîÔ∏è Strategy input & policy advice
‚úîÔ∏è Product or design feedback
‚úîÔ∏è Forensic casework & expert witness work
‚úîÔ∏è Training, speaking, reports, external review
‚úîÔ∏è Journalist support, investor sanity checks
‚úîÔ∏è And so much more.....

Flexible rates, Short turnarounds, World Leading Experts. From an hour to a multi-month activity, our consultancy model lets us work to your timeframe, not the academic calendar! 

üîó Get in touch:
https://lnkd.in/eD7JiPkK

üì¨ Or message us through LinkedIn, our ECS KEE team are standing by.

Because research should have  impact! 

#KEE #ECSConsultants #Consultancy #HireUs #ResearchImpact  #SouthamptonECS #GeekForHire

üö® ECS@Southampton has some cyber-tastic news‚Ä¶ üö®

We‚Äôre finalists for Cyber University of the Year at the National Cyber Awards!

Yes, we‚Äôve got a Cyber Security Group. Yes, we‚Äôve got a Cyber Academy. But cyber at ECS doesn‚Äôt stop there .... it leaks into everything: hardware, policy, AI, ethics, health, forensics, education‚Ä¶ if it‚Äôs got a log file, someone in ECS is excited about it!

This nomination was by ECS, but it's a celebration for the whole university. So we hope the wider Southampton community will join us in cheering our Cyber champions on!

Our ECS KEE strategy is all about championing both team and individual success ... and moments like this are exactly what we aim to celebrate!

#CyberAwards #CyberUniversity #ECSatSouthampton #KEE #KEEdoesCyber #TeamSouthampton #KnowledgeExchangeWin

University of Southampton,  The National Cyber Awards, Prof Tim Norman, Prof vladimiro sassone, Prof. Sarah M., Dr Basel Halak,

üö® ECS SOCIAL TAKEOVER INCOMING ... KEEvolution! 2- 10th August!)üö®

Our incredible Head of School, Prof Tim Norman, has (quite sensibly) vanished on a well-earned holiday this afternoon ... and in a bold move, he's left the Deputy Head (Knowledge Exchange & Enterprise) Prof. Sarah M. in charge next week.

A risky move indeed! ü§£ 

Because in her very first act of power, she‚Äôs launched a 9-day KEE Takeover .... and yes, things are about to get KEE-riously entertaining!!!

Over the next 9 days, we‚Äôll be unleashing the gloriously geeky world of Knowledge Exchange & Enterprise at ECS: spinouts, start-ups, collaborations, comedy, outreach, dollhouse crime scenes, and a bit of academic revolution.

It‚Äôs fun .... It‚Äôs unapologetically KEE!

Will we return control when Tim gets back?
 ü´¢...Probably.
 üòà...Maybe.
 ü§ñ...We‚Äôll get back to you.

#KEETakeover #ECSsouthampton #KnowledgeExchange #KEEriousBusiness #SocialTakeover #InnovationWithIntent

University of Southampton

Congratulations to Stewart Edmondson, who has been made a Fellow of the University of Southampton.

This celebrates the strong bond between #ECS and the UK Electronics Skills Foundation (UKESF), for example:

- Fourteen ECS students graduating this summer were UKESF Scholars during their degree, benefiting from around 400 weeks of valuable industry experience through the scheme.
- Since 2012, over 200 Southampton undergraduates have received UKESF Scholarships, the highest of any of the 29 UK universities involved, and around a quarter of all of the scholarships awarded nationally.
- Our #ElectronicsEverywhere collaboration, developing hands-on electronics kits and training for A-Level Physics and Computer Science students, has now reached over 900 secondary schools and colleges‚Äînearly a quarter of all sixth forms in the UK.
company_updates.reshared_post_description:
More than 200 of our past and present Engineering students have kickstarted their careers thanks to scholarships from the UK Electronics Skills Foundation (UKESF)

This summer, we‚Äôre proud to celebrate the charity‚Äôs CEO, Stewart Edmondson, who has been awarded a Fellowship from the University of Southampton in recognition of his outstanding contribution to the future of UK engineering.

A huge congratulations to Stewart, and to this year‚Äôs brilliant cohort of graduating scholars! üëèüéì

#WeAreUoS #Graduation2025 | University of Southampton Alumni and Supporters School of Engineering, University of Southampton

company_updates.description:
So excited to return to ACM-W Europe womENcourage this year, having first attended in its inaugural year (2014) as a student, and having been involved as a poster chair in 2018-2020. 
I love this community and can't wait to meet the ACM-W: ACMs Women in Computing team and all the attendees in Brasov, including of course our very own Naomi Pitzer Lauren Deeth-Kelt Semeli Kyriacou Abha Desai and Rosalind Thwaites from University of Southampton.
Will I see you there?
company_updates.reshared_post_description:
We are excited to welcome Dr. Adriana Wilde (University of Southampton, UK) as a keynote at #womENcourage2025!
Dr. Wilde is a Lecturer in Electronics and Computer Science and Co-Director of the Centre for Health Technologies. Her research spans computing education, learning analytics, and smart technologies for independent living. She is also a strong advocate for diversity in computing through ACM-W.
 ‚ú® Don‚Äôt miss her keynote in Brasov this September!
 üëâ Register now: https://lnkd.in/g3RijjVp

#KEETakeover Day 2

Today we shine a spotlight on EPrints Services! Led by Professor Justin Bradley

What do open source, global impact, and a little Southampton ingenuity have in common? EPrints! Built for Open Access, Made at Southampton and  Trusted Worldwide!

EPrints isn‚Äôt just software, it‚Äôs a KEE success story .... Born in ECS back in 2000, it was the first open access repository platform of its kind. Now it powers research visibility across the globe, all while remaining proudly open source, flexible, and standards compliant.

Through EPrints Services, our team build, host, and tailor repositories that meet real institutional needs. That‚Äôs Knowledge Exchange in action:

 üõ†Ô∏è Turning academic research into sustainable services
 üåç Enabling open science and policy alignment worldwide
 üí∑ Bringing income, reputation and real-world impact back to the university
It‚Äôs practical, powerful, and pure Southampton.

Want to know more? The team‚Äôs here to help:
 üîó https://lnkd.in/eSNiNGdm

#KEETakeover #EPrints #KnowledgeExchange #OpenAccess #ECSatSouthampton #SouthamptonImpact #RepositoriesDoneRight

We cover every part of EEE and Computer Science including AI, cyber, electronics, smart materials, biometrics, forensics, signal processing, robotics, ethics, systems, sustainability, component design and so much more!

#KEE #ECSConsultants #Consultancy #HireUs #ResearchImpact  #SouthamptonECS #GeekForHire

üö® ECS@Southampton has some cyber-tastic news‚Ä¶ üö®

We‚Äôre finalists for Cyber University of the Year at the National Cyber Awards!

Yes, we‚Äôve got a Cyber Security Group. Yes, we‚Äôve got a Cyber Academy. But cyber at ECS doesn‚Äôt stop there .... it leaks into everything: hardware, policy, AI, ethics, health, forensics, education‚Ä¶ if it‚Äôs got a log file, someone in ECS is excited about it!

This nomination was by ECS, but it's a celebration for the whole university. So we hope the wider Southampton community will join us in cheering our Cyber champions on!

Our ECS KEE strategy is all about championing both team and individual success ... and moments like this are exactly what we aim to celebrate!

#CyberAwards #CyberUniversity #ECSatSouthampton #KEE #KEEdoesCyber #TeamSouthampton #KnowledgeExchangeWin

University of Southampton,  The National Cyber Awards, Prof Tim Norman, Prof vladimiro sassone, Prof. Sarah M., Dr Basel Halak,

üö® ECS SOCIAL TAKEOVER INCOMING ... KEEvolution! 2- 10th August!)üö®

Our incredible Head of School, Prof Tim Norman, has (quite sensibly) vanished on a well-earned holiday this afternoon ... and in a bold move, he's left the Deputy Head (Knowledge Exchange & Enterprise) Prof. Sarah M. in charge next week.

A risky move indeed! ü§£ 

Because in her very first act of power, she‚Äôs launched a 9-day KEE Takeover .... and yes, things are about to get KEE-riously entertaining!!!

Over the next 9 days, we‚Äôll be unleashing the gloriously geeky world of Knowledge Exchange & Enterprise at ECS: spinouts, start-ups, collaborations, comedy, outreach, dollhouse crime scenes, and a bit of academic revolution.

It‚Äôs fun .... It‚Äôs unapologetically KEE!

Will we return control when Tim gets back?
 ü´¢...Probably.
 üòà...Maybe.
 ü§ñ...We‚Äôll get back to you.

#KEETakeover #ECSsouthampton #KnowledgeExchange #KEEriousBusiness #SocialTakeover #InnovationWithIntent

University of Southampton

Congratulations to Stewart Edmondson, who has been made a Fellow of the University of Southampton.

This celebrates the strong bond between #ECS and the UK Electronics Skills Foundation (UKESF), for example:

- Fourteen ECS students graduating this summer were UKESF Scholars during their degree, benefiting from around 400 weeks of valuable industry experience through the scheme.
- Since 2012, over 200 Southampton undergraduates have received UKESF Scholarships, the highest of any of the 29 UK universities involved, and around a quarter of all of the scholarships awarded nationally.
- Our #ElectronicsEverywhere collaboration, developing hands-on electronics kits and training for A-Level Physics and Computer Science students, has now reached over 900 secondary schools and colleges‚Äînearly a quarter of all sixth forms in the UK.

I could not be more proud seeing students I have assisted getting their moment in the limelight and celebrating their huge achievements.

It's been another hectic semester with many deadlines combined with some really fun Deep Learning teaching with Antonia Marcu who brought additional energy to the lectures and led some thought-provoking discussions. ICML starts on Sunday, and I'm happy that my PhD student, Tyler Clark  (co-supervised with Christine Evers), and our collaborator Mark Towers had our work on efficient deep reinforcement learning accepted - Tyler will be presenting "Beyond The Rainbow: High Performance Deep Reinforcement Learning on a Desktop PC" in poster session 5 on Thursday 17th.

I'm also really happy that Damian Smith, Harvey Mannering and Antonia Marcu had their work "Functional Alignment Can Mislead: Examining Model Stitching" accepted as a spotlight. A lot of work went into this paper, building from Damian and Antonia's previous NeurIPS workshop contribution last year, and I together with rest of the VLC group were pleased to support through "discussions, feedback, support, snacks, and good fun" (to quote Antonia!). Damian and Antonia will present in session 4 on Wednesday. 

I decided to skip heading back to Vancouver (having already been in December and then racked up airmiles to go to Lukla and trek to Everest Base Camp at Easter), and instead will support the ECS @ UoS team at graduation next Wednesday, where we'll see many of our undergraduate graduands become graduates and also celebrate the successes of many of our PhD students. Over the summer we'll get back to research and the team will be working towards ICLR submissions whilst we wait to hear about NeurIPS. In September the group will be welcoming a bumper crop of new PhD students which is really exciting.

Our experts have been named semi-finalists of the international XPrize competition for their pioneering work in using drones to fight wildfires üèÜ

They‚Äôve developed a programme that controls a swarm of drones capable of detecting small fires across a 1,000km¬≤ area and containing them within minutes. The XPrize competition offers up to $5 million to further fund the winners.

Dr Mohammad D. Soorati said: ‚ÄúAmid the increasing frequency of natural disasters worldwide, our aerial fleet can detect and respond rapidly before fires escalate into catastrophes. This breakthrough in drone swarm technology will have a major impact on high-speed disaster responses, with the capability to end destructive wildfires within the first few minutes.‚Äù

The team includes experts from our schools of Geography and Environmental Science, School of Engineering, University of Southampton  and ECS @ UoS, supported by scientists from both the UK and US.

I'm so excited (and slightly nervous) that our new online MA in Artificial Intelligence is going live with its first cohort this week! Aimed at a non-STEM market, it will teach people enough of the technology behind AI for them to have a firm grasp of its capabilities and potential but also a critical understanding to help them make sound business and policy decisions that cut through the AI marketing hype and toxic tech-bro public discourse. 

Colleagues from our school and across the University have spent decades experimenting with online eduction - we launched one of the first UK MOOCs in 2014 through FutureLearn (Web Science: How the Web Is Changing the World), and even had our own online Computer Science MSc in the 1980s when students dialed in through modems. So we're really the excited that the University has teamed up with CEG Digital in an institutional commitment to developing flexible Masters training for professionals.

It‚Äôs an honour to receive the Best Demonstration Award at AAMAS 2025 for our demo ‚ÄúSerious Games for Ethical Preference Elicitation‚Äù!

Congratulations to Jayati Deshmukh, who is leading this work, to Zijie Liang, who developed the game, and to co-authors Vahid Yazdanpanah and Sarvapali (Gopal) Ramchurn, who have been providing guidance and advice.

Thanks also to Behrad Koohy, who‚Äôs helped us run this demo at AAMAS.

We developed a serious game that elicits the ethical preferences of users through a series of dilemmas. The ultimate aim is to develop autonomous agents that act in accordance with people‚Äòs ethical standpoints.

One of the things I love about our approach is that founders don‚Äôt feel like they‚Äôre facing ‚Äútrial by investor‚Äù when it gets to Demo Day. üî•

By the time they‚Äôve got to the pitch, we‚Äôve already helped them stress-test their assumptions, so big questions don‚Äôt feel like 'gotcha' moments.

With Future Worlds Demo Day 25 fast approaching, I‚Äôd love to hear from investors in my network‚Ä¶

What‚Äôs your number one tip for pitching founders?

I‚Äôll start with three of mine‚Ä¶

1. One sentence, right upfront, that tells them what your startup is. Don‚Äôt start with a slow-build back story where everyone has to wait a minute for the punchline - investors want to know as soon as possible if you fit within their investment criteria or not.

2. Who‚Äôs your customer? What‚Äôs their problem? You have to be super clear on why anyone should care about what you‚Äôre doing. (And, what evidence do you have to support your claims?)

3. K.I.S.S. - ‚ÄúKeep It Simple, Stupid!‚Äù This is especially important in our academic context; a pitch is not a lecture or an academic paper. Time is precious, you can‚Äôt explain everything and it‚Äôs not about showing how clever you are. Hit the key headlines and let investors ask you questions for the detail they‚Äôre interested in.

Startups supported by Future Worlds have raised over ¬£110m as they‚Äôve gone on to change the world. There is huge opportunity to be seized for researchers and students turned startup founders, and for the investors who back them. 

I'm really looking forward to witnessing next week's Demo Day pitches from our phenomenal founders. What advice do you have for the founders who will be in front of our investor audience?

Still buzzing after yesterday‚Äôs Science Comedy Academy session with the incredible comedian Ruby Carr and her dad ‚Äî comedian and ECS professor Leslie Carr !

They both have a remarkable gift for bringing out the funny side in everyone, and their energy was infectious. The session was fun, refreshing, and surprisingly insightful ‚Äî I walked away having learned so much about myself.

The ECS Science Comedy Academy is a fantastic initiative that helps people build confidence, step out of their comfort zones, and develop skills that are valuable in so many contexts ‚Äî from public speaking to teaching and beyond.

If you're ever offered the chance to take part, do it!

We had the chance to connect with passionate colleagues, exchange ideas, and learn about other impactful mentoring initiatives across the University of Southampton 

The energy in the room was a testament to the power of mentorship in shaping inclusive, supportive, and thriving communities.

Excited to keep building momentum and collaborating with others to create even more meaningful mentoring experiences!

name: Conservatory of Music at University of the Pacific
description:
The Conservatory of Music at University of the Pacific prepares tomorrow‚Äôs performers, teachers, therapists, composers, scholars and music industry leaders.
We offer 11 imaginative undergraduate and graduate degree programs as well as music minor options. Our courses provide a strong foundation in musicianship; supportive one-to-one instruction in instrumental, jazz, piano and voice; and a broad range of performing ensembles. In class and in our communities, we demonstrate how music is central to the world‚Äôs many economies, cultures and stories.
